alert.note: Alert for Northeastern Crook; Northern Campbell; Western Crook; Wyoming Black Hills (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS RapidCity (Western South Dakota and Northeastern Wyoming)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 04 at 2:20PM MDT by NWS RapidCity
info.description: ...STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT NORTHEASTERN CAMPBELL AND NORTHWESTERN CROOK COUNTIES THROUGH 300 PM MDT... At 220 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 3 miles southeast of Rockypoint to 6 miles northeast of New Haven to near Alva. Movement was north at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to vegetation is possible. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Rockypoint around 225 PM MDT. Lightning Flat around 230 PM MDT. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 800 PM MDT for northeastern Wyoming.

area.areaDesc: Northeastern Crook; Northern Campbell; Western Crook; Wyoming Black Hills
